title: Episode 3-1 Highlights | Park Sung-hoon Interfering with Kim Soo-hyun & Kim Ji-won's Marriage—His Mysterious True Nature?!
synopsis: A hunting dog incident reveals Yoon Eun-sung's disturbing philosophy about 'valuable' vs 'abandoned' lives. Meanwhile, CCTV footage hints at a family betrayal. A flashback to 20 years ago shows a young boy who killed dogs—with an eerily familiar mindset. The episode ends with Hyun-woo discovering Hye-in and Eun-sung had drinks alone together.

contents.original: 이리 와. 어, 이리 와, 이리 와.
contents.pronunciation: Iri wa. Eo, iri wa, iri wa.
contents.translation: Come here. Yeah, come here, come here.
Good job.
Is this one a Sapsaree?
contents.culture: 삽살개 (Sapsaree) is a traditional Korean dog breed known for its shaggy coat, considered a national treasure.

contents.translation: Yes, Chairman.
Wow, that one is really handsome.
He's not just handsome.

grammar.pattern: ~기만 한 게 아니다 (giman han ge anida)
grammar.example: 잘생기기만 한 게 아니고요 = he's not just handsome

contents.original: 몇 년 전에 저희 집에 불이 났는데 이 녀석이 제 아들을 구했습니다.
contents.pronunciation: Myeot nyeon jeon-e jeohui jib-e bul-i nanneunde i nyeoseok-i je adeul-eul guhaetseumnida.
contents.translation: A few years ago, our house caught fire and this one saved my son.

grammar.example: 불이 났는데 = a fire broke out

contents.translation: Really?

contents.original: 예, 그날 저희도 없었는데 이 녀석이 잠든 제 아들을 깨워서 끌고 나오지 않았으면 정말 큰일 났습니다.
contents.pronunciation: Ye, geunal jeohui-do eopseotneunde i nyeoseok-i jamdeun je adeul-eul kkaewoseo kkeulgo naoji anasseumyeon jeongmal keunil nasseumnida.
contents.translation: Yes, we weren't home that day, and if this one hadn't woken up my sleeping son and dragged him out, it would have been a disaster.

grammar.example: 큰일 났습니다 = it would have been a disaster
끌고 나오지 않았으면 = if he hadn't dragged him out

contents.translation: Wow, he's smart and very loyal.
Any chance you'd consider selling him?

grammar.example: 팔 생각 없나 = any thought of selling?

contents.translation: I'm sorry, Chairman. We're family.
contents.culture: The owner considers the dog family, not property—a sentiment that will be tested by money.

contents.translation: I'll give you 100 million won.
contents.culture: 1억 won is an enormous sum for a dog, showing the chaebol's casual wealth and how money can buy anything.

contents.translation: What?
But ours doesn't even have a pedigree.

grammar.example: 족보도 없다 = doesn't even have a pedigree

contents.culture: 족보 (pedigree) for dogs is like a family registry showing purebred lineage.

contents.original: 족보는 상관없고요. 시간 지나면 금액은 내려갑니다.
contents.pronunciation: Jokbo-neun sanggwan-eopgoyo. Sigan jinamyeon geumak-eun naeryeogamnida.
contents.translation: Pedigree doesn't matter. The price goes down as time passes.
contents.culture: Hye-in uses negotiation tactics—creating urgency by threatening to lower the price.

contents.translation: I'll give you 90 million.
Now it's 80 million.
Wait. I'll sell.

contents.pronunciation: Geundeyo, il-eok da jusimyeon an doemnikka?
contents.translation: But could you give me the full 100 million?

grammar.example: 주시면 안 됩니까 = couldn't you give?

contents.culture: The owner's quick reversal from 'family' to bargaining exposes how money corrupts stated values.

contents.translation: Sure.
I'm sorry. I wasn't in my right mind yesterday.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'not in one's right mind'
grammar.example: 제정신이 아니었어요 = I wasn't in my right mind

contents.original: 돌려드릴게요. 부탁 좀 드릴게요. 한숨도 못 잤어요.
contents.pronunciation: Dollyeodeurilgeyo. Butak jom deurilgeyo. Hansum-do mot jasseoyo.
contents.translation: I'll return it. Please. I couldn't sleep a wink.

grammar.example: 한숨도 못 잤어요 = I couldn't sleep at all

contents.original: 이 개는 제가 회장님께 선물하겠다고 이미 말씀드려서 그건 곤란합니다.
contents.pronunciation: I gae-neun jega hoejangnim-kke seonmul-hagetdago imi malsseumdeuryeoseo geugeon gollan-hamnida.
contents.translation: I already told the Chairman I'd give him this dog as a gift, so that's difficult.

contents.original: 죄송한데요. 이놈은 제 자식을 구해준 진짜 가족 같은 놈인데 내가 돈을 받고 팔다니. 제가 돌았습니다.
contents.pronunciation: Joesonghande-yo. Inom-eun je jasik-eul guhaejun jinjja gajok gateun nom-inde naega don-eul batgo paldani. Jega dorasseumnida.
contents.translation: I'm sorry, but this one saved my child—he's like real family. I can't believe I sold him for money. I must have been crazy.

grammar.explanation: Ending expressing disbelief at one's own action

grammar.example: 제가 돌았습니다 = I must have been crazy

contents.translation: Alright. Then take the money back.
Thank you. Thank you. Thank you, Director. Thank you.
Oh my. What are you doing?

contents.original: 돈 받고 판 걸 죄책감을 느낀다면서요? 그럼 귀찮아서 버린 걸로 해요. 그럼 좀 나은가요?
contents.pronunciation: Don batgo pan geol joechaekgam-eul neukkindamyeonseoyo? Geureom gwichana-seo beorin geollo haeyo. Geureom jom naeun-gayo?
contents.translation: You felt guilty about selling him for money? Then let's say you abandoned him because he was a nuisance. Does that feel better?

grammar.example: 죄책감을 느낀다면서요 = you said you felt guilty
버린 걸로 해요 = let's say you abandoned

contents.culture: Hye-in's sharp sarcasm exposes the hypocrisy of the owner's guilt.

contents.translation: What are you doing right now?

grammar.example: 뭐 하는 겁니까 = what are you doing?

contents.translation: Oh, you scared me. You sent it to slaughter.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'what a surprise/you scared me'

grammar.example: 도살을 보냈네 = you sent it to slaughter

contents.translation: I asked what you're doing.

grammar.example: 뭐 하는 거냐고요 = I said, what are you doing

contents.translation: It was a joke.
This is a joke?

grammar.example: 장난이라고요? = you're saying it's a joke?

contents.translation: What else would it be?

grammar.explanation: Rhetorical question 'what else would it be'
grammar.example: 아니면 뭐겠어요 = if not that, then what?

contents.original: 돈 돌려주셨죠? 받으셨고요. 제가 증인입니다. 계약은 끝났고요.
contents.pronunciation: Don dollyeojusyeotjyo? Badeusyeotgoyo. Jega jeung-in-imnida. Gyeyak-eun kkeutnatgoyo.
contents.translation: You returned the money, right? And you received it. I'm a witness. The contract is over.

grammar.example: 계약은 끝났고요 = the contract is over

contents.translation: You can go now.
Yes, thank you. Thank you. Thank you.
But... why can't you kill them?

grammar.pattern: 왜 ~(으)면 안 되다 (wae eumyeon an doeda)
grammar.example: 왜 죽이면 안 되죠 = why can't you kill them

contents.culture: This chilling question reveals Eun-sung's disturbing worldview.

contents.original: 아까 들었잖아요. 애지중지 키웠고 가족이나 마찬가지라고.
contents.pronunciation: Akka deureotjanayo. Aejijungji kiwotgo gajok-ina machangaji-rago.
contents.translation: You heard earlier. They raised it with care and said it's like family.

grammar.example: 애지중지 키웠다 = raised with great care

contents.original: 그럼 버려진 애들이나 주인 없는 애들은 상관없고요.
contents.pronunciation: Geureom beoryeojin ae-deul-ina juin eomneun ae-deul-eun sanggwan-eopgoyo.
contents.translation: Then abandoned ones or ones without owners don't matter.

grammar.example: 주인 없는 애들 = ones without owners

contents.culture: This line is crucial—Eun-sung questions why only 'valued' lives matter, hinting at his own trauma as someone who was 'abandoned.'

contents.translation: Yes.

contents.original: 저기가 수비구역 CCTV인데 저희 식구 말고는 드나든 사람이 없는 것 같은데요, 아버지.
contents.pronunciation: Jeogi-ga subiguyeok CCTV-inde jeohui sikgu malgo-neun deunadеun saram-i eomneun geot gateundeyo, abeoji.
contents.translation: That's the security area CCTV, and it looks like no one came in or out except our family, Father.

grammar.example: 드나든 사람 = people who came and went

contents.original: 그럼 진짜 내부 사람들 중 누구라는 얘기인가?
contents.pronunciation: Geureom jinjja naebu saram-deul jung nuguraneun yaegi-inga?
contents.translation: Then you're saying it's really one of the insiders?

grammar.example: 내부 사람들 중 = among the insiders

contents.translation: Wait. Stop.
Who is it? Only the back is captured.

grammar.example: 뒷모습만 찍혀서 = only the back was captured

contents.translation: You can't even recognize your own brother?
No way, Father.

contents.original: 저기 아직 확실한 거 아니잖아요. 설마 범석이가 그랬겠어요?
contents.pronunciation: Jeogi ajik hwaksilhan geo anijanayo. Seolma Beomseok-iga geuraetgesseoyo?
contents.translation: That's not confirmed yet. Surely Beom-seok didn't do it?

grammar.example: 확실한 거 아니잖아요 = it's not certain yet

contents.translation: Send Beom-seok to China.

grammar.example: 중국에 날려봐 = send him to China

contents.culture: Being 'sent to China' in a chaebol context often means exile/punishment—being removed from headquarters.

contents.translation: Yes, Chairman.
Pack your bags.

contents.original: 벌써요? 검사 서, 돌아가신 지 보면.
contents.pronunciation: Beolsseoyo? Geomsa seo, doragasin ji bomyeon.
contents.translation: Already? If you look at when the prosecutor passed away.
Honey, do you remember that kid?
Hm?

contents.original: 아니, 왜 한 20몇 년 전인가 양 소장 집 삽살개 죽어서 난리 났을 때. 그 범인 자꾸 보니까 초등학생이었던 거.
contents.pronunciation: Ani, wae han seumulnyeot nyeon jeon-inga Yang sojang jip sapsalgae jugеoseo nalli nassеul ttae. Geu beomin jakku bonikka chodeunghaksaeng-ieotteon geo.
contents.translation: Remember about 20-something years ago when Director Yang's Sapsaree died and there was a big fuss? The culprit turned out to be an elementary school kid.

grammar.example: 난리 났을 때 = when there was chaos

contents.culture: This flashback reveals a dark secret from the past connected to the present mystery.

contents.original: 어, 맞다. 그 상록원 살던 애. 걔가 공부를 잘해서 퀸즈그룹에서 장학금을 받는다고 들었던 것 같아.
contents.pronunciation: Eo, matda. Geu Sangrokwon saldeon ae. Gyae-ga gongbu-reul jalhaeseo Kwinsjeu Geurup-eseo janghakgeum-eul batneundago deureotdeon geot gata.
contents.translation: Oh, right. That kid who lived at Sangrokwon. I heard he was good at studying and got a scholarship from Queens Group.

grammar.example: 장학금을 받다 = to receive a scholarship

contents.culture: 상록원 (Sangrokwon) appears to be an orphanage or care facility. The Queens Group scholarship connects the mysterious child to the Hong family.

contents.original: 여기 왔을 때 내가 밥도 몇 번 차려주고 그랬어.
contents.pronunciation: Yeogi wasseul ttae naega bap-do myeot beon charyeojugo geuraesseo.
contents.translation: When he came here, I made him meals a few times.

grammar.example: 밥도 몇 번 차려주고 = made meals a few times

contents.original: 그랬지. 걔가 경찰한테 잡히고 그런 말을 했었잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Geuraetji. Gyae-ga gyeongchal-hante japigo geureon mar-eul haesseotjanah.
contents.translation: Right. When he was caught by the police, he said something like that.

grammar.example: 경찰한테 잡히고 = was caught by police

contents.original: 이거 너 맞지? 인마, 너 왜 남의 집 귀한 개를 죽여?
contents.pronunciation: Igeo neo matji? Inma, neo wae nam-ui jip gwihan gae-reul jugyeo?
contents.translation: This was you, right? Kid, why did you kill someone else's precious dog?

contents.original: 나 이거 그냥 못 넘어가요. 너 그게 얼마짜리인지 알아, 이 씨.
contents.pronunciation: Na igeo geunyang mot neomeogayo. Neo geuge eolmajjari-inji ara, i ssi.
contents.translation: I can't just let this go. Do you know how much that's worth?

grammar.example: 그냥 못 넘어가요 = I can't just let this go
얼마짜리인지 알아 = do you know how much it's worth

contents.translation: I'm sorry. Say you were wrong, quickly.

contents.original: 그런데요, 귀한 개면 뭐가 달라요? 안 귀한 개는 죽여도 되는 건가 해서요.
contents.pronunciation: Geureonde-yo, gwihan gaemyeon mwoga dallayo? An gwihan gae-neun jugyeodo doeneun geonga haeseoyo.
contents.translation: But what's different about a precious dog? I was wondering if it's okay to kill dogs that aren't precious.

grammar.example: 되는 건가 해서요 = I was wondering if it's okay

contents.culture: This chilling line from young Eun-sung mirrors his present-day question, revealing his consistent disturbing worldview about 'value' and worth.

contents.translation: Why does a kid like that even exist?

grammar.example: 저런 애 = a kid like that

contents.original: 맞다. 그런 얘기 했던 것 같아. 무슨 애가 애 같지 않아서 섬뜩했잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Matda. Geureon yaegi haetteon geot gata. Museun ae-ga ae gatji anaseo seomtteuk-haetjanah.
contents.translation: Right. I think he said something like that. It was creepy how the kid didn't seem like a kid.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'doesn't seem like a child'
grammar.example: 애가 애 같지 않아서 = the kid didn't seem like a kid

contents.translation: Doesn't it look similar?

grammar.example: 닮은 거 아냐 = doesn't it resemble?

contents.translation: Who?
What brings you here at this hour?

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'what brings you/what's the occasion'

contents.translation: Hye-in drank a bit too much.

grammar.example: 술을 많이 마셨어요 = drank a lot

contents.translation: She drank?
Hye-in, Hye-in.

contents.original: 좀 두세요, 자는 거예요. 혜인이는 취하면 자야 되거든요.
contents.pronunciation: Jom duseyo, janeun geoyeyo. Hyeini-neun chwi-hamyeon jaya doеgeodeunyo.
contents.translation: Let her be, she's sleeping. Hye-in needs to sleep when she's drunk.

grammar.example: 자야 되거든요 = because she needs to sleep

contents.translation: Hong Hye-in.

grammar.explanation: Using full name to wake someone up

contents.original: 오면서 계속 잤으니까 한 10분만 더 두면 깰 거예요. 아니면 이따 제가 데리고 들어갈 테니까 먼저 들어가 계시던가요.
contents.pronunciation: Omyeonseo gyesok jaseunikka han sip-bun-man deo dumyeon kkael geoyeyo. Animyeon itta jega derigo deureogal tenikka meonjeo deureoga gyesideon-gayo.
contents.translation: She slept all the way here, so if you leave her for about 10 more minutes, she'll wake up. Or I'll bring her in later, so you can go in first.

grammar.example: 들어갈 테니까 = since I'll bring her in

contents.translation: How much did you give her to drink?

grammar.explanation: Causative verb meaning 'to make someone eat/drink'
grammar.example: 먹인 겁니까 = did you make her drink

contents.translation: What?

contents.original: 아니, 얘가 안 먹어서 그렇지 한 번 먹으면 말술인데 이렇게 쓰러질 때까지 뭘 얼마나 먹인 건데 이렇게 꽐라가 되냐고요.
contents.pronunciation: Ani, yae-ga an meоgeoseo geureochi han beon meogeumyeon malsul-inde ireoke sseureojil ttae-kkaji mwol eolmana meogin geonde ireoke kkwalla-ga doenyagoyo.
contents.translation: No, she doesn't usually drink but when she does, she can really hold her liquor—so how much did you make her drink to pass out like this?

grammar.explanation: Noun meaning 'heavy drinker/able to drink a lot'

grammar.example: 꽐라가 되다 = to get completely wasted

contents.culture: Hyun-woo is suspicious and defensive—clearly questioning why Eun-sung got Hye-in so drunk.

contents.translation: It's because she was upset.

grammar.example: 속상하셔서 그래 = it's because she was upset

contents.original: 요즘 자려도 시끄러워서 잘 수가 없네.
contents.pronunciation: Yojeum jaryeodo sikkeureowoseo jal suga eomne.
contents.translation: These days it's so noisy I can't even sleep.

grammar.explanation: Ending meaning 'even if I try to'

contents.translation: Good work, take care.

contents.original: 그래, 너도 잘 자고. 내일 저녁에 봐.
contents.pronunciation: Geurae, neodo jal jago. Naeil jeonyeok-e bwa.
contents.translation: Yeah, sleep well too. See you tomorrow evening.

contents.original: 내일 저녁에는 왜 또... 아니, 오늘은 헤르만 회장이랑 만나셨다고 들었는데 내일은 또 왜 보시나 해서.
contents.pronunciation: Naeil jeonyeok-eneun wae tto... Ani, oneul-eun Hereuman hoejang-irang mannasyeotdago deureotneunde naeil-eun tto wae bosina haeseo.
contents.translation: Why tomorrow evening again... I heard you met with Chairman Hermann today, so I wondered why you're meeting again tomorrow.

grammar.example: 왜 보시나 해서 = I was wondering why you're meeting

contents.original: 오늘 못 봤어요, 헤르만 회장이랑. 저희 둘만 봤어요. 저희 둘만 마셨고.
contents.pronunciation: Oneul mot bwasseoyo, Hereuman hoejang-irang. Jeohui dul-man bwasseoyo. Jeohui dul-man masyeotgo.
contents.translation: I didn't meet Chairman Hermann today. We just met the two of us. Just the two of us drank.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'just the two of us'
grammar.example: 저희 둘만 = just the two of us

contents.culture: This revelation that Eun-sung and Hye-in drank alone together is a bombshell for Hyun-woo.

contents.original: 맞다, 아침에 오렌지 갈아먹는 거 잊지 말고 넌 혈압으로 그거 꼭 먹어야 되잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Matda, achim-e orenji gara-meongneun geo itji malgo neon hyeorap-euro geugeo kkok meogеoya doеjanah.
contents.translation: Right, don't forget to have blended orange juice in the morning—you need to have it for your blood pressure.

grammar.example: 오렌지 갈아먹다 = to drink blended orange

contents.culture: Eun-sung's intimate knowledge of Hye-in's health routines shows their close relationship.

contents.translation: Okay, okay. I got it, I got it.
Okay. Then goodbye.

contents.original: 네, 우리 혜인이 좀 잘 부탁드려요.
contents.pronunciation: Ne, uri Hyeini jom jal butakdeuryeoyo.
contents.translation: Yes, please take good care of our Hye-in.

grammar.example: 잘 부탁드려요 = please take care of her

contents.culture: Eun-sung calling Hye-in '우리 혜인이' (our Hye-in) is possessive and provocative in front of her husband.

contents.translation: Driver Hong.
Yes.

contents.original: 저분 잘 좀 부탁드려요. 지금 좀 많이 취하신 것 같은데.
contents.pronunciation: Jeo-bun jal jom butakdeuryeoyo. Jigeum jom mani chwi-hasin geot gateunde.
contents.translation: Please take care of him. He seems quite drunk right now.

contents.original: 정신도 많이 없으신 것 같으니까 꼭 본가까지는 모시다 드리시고.
contents.pronunciation: Jeongsin-do mani eom-eusin geot gateunikka kkok bonga-kkaji-neun mosida deurisigo.
contents.translation: He seems out of it, so please make sure to escort him all the way to the main house.

grammar.example: 본가까지 = all the way to the main house

contents.culture: Hyun-woo is being petty by pretending Eun-sung is the drunk one who needs to be taken care of.

contents.translation: Understood.
What are you doing? Get in.
contents.culture: Hyun-woo asserting his position as Hye-in's husband by taking her inside himself.
